Room.Name: Entrance to No Man's Land
Room.Description: The walls of the alleyway have been spray-painted over many times over the years. One section of graffiti actually looks legible, it says: This section has been designed for levels 5 through 10 If you are above level 15 please don't expect much fun. If you are below level 5 enter at your own risk. Another section of graffiti says "Raff Rules!" There is a boulevard to the east and Emerald Avenue is visible to the west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This section of town has been overrun by the Troll gang. Even the police stay out of here for fear of being brutalized. This was once a nice lower-middleclass neighborhood, but know the gangs run the streets. All the shops and homes have been boarded up and abandoned. An alleyway is to the west and the street continues east. An over- grown lot is to the south.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Everywhere you look you see signs of recent violence. Patches of blood lie everywhere and broken sticks and abandoned knifes are strewn here and there. An over-grown lot is to the south. White Dragon Boulevard leads east and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Only gang members dare wander the streets here. What used to be the armory lies to the south. White Dragon Boulevard leads east and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Black Dragon Avenue used to run south from here but the way has been blocked by the toppling of a building into the street. White Dragon boulevard continues east and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Ice Dragon Way leads south from here. It used to run the whole length of the neighborhood and way lined with beautiful crystal sculptures. White Dragon boulevard leads east and west from here.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: A once majestic inn with a white marble facade lies to the south. Unfortunately, it has fallen into disrepair and decay. You can continue east or west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This is the north-east corner of the neighborhood. White Dragon boulevard heads west and Bronze Dragon street heads south.

Room.Name: Gangland Camp
Room.Description: A huge building was going to be built here, but they gave the project up when violence took over the town. Now it is just a weed-strewn plot of land. The lot continues east and there is a road north.

Room.Name: Gangland Camp
Room.Description: This was planned to be a park, but the developer was scared out of town by the gang. Now it is just a dusty square of land. The park was started to the south. The lot continues west and there is a street to the north.

Room.Name: Gangland Camp
Room.Description: Well actually, this is what USED to be the armory. The equipment has all been stolen or broken beyond repair. The back wall of the building has been bashed down, allowing you to go south. White Dragon Boulevard is north.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Ice Dragon Way bends east and south from here. You notice a lot of blood dried into the dirt here.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Ice Dragon Way bends to the north and west here. There are footprints here. They seem to indicate a large struggle took place here recently. What used to be the town Magic shop is to the east.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The wizard was tough but he couldn't take on 50 of them at once. So he died and they took all his stuff and used it on their fellowmen. The front door leads west back out to the street. There is a back door leading to another street to the east.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Bronze Dragon street goes north and south. The back door to what remains of the magic shop is west.

Room.Name: Gangland Camp
Room.Description: They began construction of a pleasant plaza here, though you wouldn't have known it if I hadn't told you. It has been renamed in honor of the Dragon gang's idol, the Dracolich. It has become sort of a training ground. There is a short cut to the east and an overgrown lot of land to the north.

Room.Name: Gangland Camp
Room.Description: This is a shortcut between Dracolich Plaza and the center of town. Dracolich Plaza is to the west and the shortcut continues south.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Several smashed crystal statues line the Way here. You begin to wonder who smashed them, and with what. The Way bends out of sight to the north and continues south. To the east is a courtyard.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Once it was the courtyard of a beautiful building complex. But alas, someone forgot to water the plants and they all died. Then again, you wonder how many people have died here too. The courtyard extends to the south and there is a road to the west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: There used to be a gate out to the east here which led to the rest of Midgaard. The gate has rusted permanently shut. The street goes north and south.

Room.Name: Shortcut
Room.Description: The shortcut extends north. There is a street to the east.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The Way continues north and intersects with Yellow Dragon Avenue to the south. For some reason, you somehow realize that there is a shortcut to the west that leads to Dracolich Plaza.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Once full of lush green plants, it is now barren of growth. A set of stairs used to extend up to a suite of rooms but the set is missing stairs 3-15. The courtyard extends north and there is a street to the south.

Room.Name: Old Abandoned Warehouse
Room.Description: Once the center of a lucrative storage business, it has fallen to disrepair like everything else. It is now the hideout of the Dragon gang. The gang leader runs his reign of terror from here. There is a wooden door barely on the hinges to the east.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The street runs north and south. There is an old wooden door leading to a warehouse to the west. The warehouse LOOKS abandoned. . .

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Yellow Dragon Road is the southern boundary of Troll Territory. The road extends east. You enter "no-man's land" to the south.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The road runs east and west. Ice Dragon Way leads north from here.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The roads continues east and west. There is a courtyard to the north. You enter "no man's land" to the south.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: There is a barred window to the north. There appears to be a light coming from the cracks around it. The road extends east and west from here. Or you can enter "no man's land" south from here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Looking through the window, you see a gang leader plotting the demise of the ogres.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Bronze Dragon Street intersects here and runs north. Yellow Dragon ends here but continues to the west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues south and east; or there is a street to the north.

Room.Name: Gangland Camp
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues south east and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues south, east and west; or there is a street to the north.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues south, east, and west; or there is a street to the north.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues south and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues north and east; or there is a street to the south.

Room.Name: NO MAN'S LAND
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues north, east and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues north, east, and west; or there is a street to the south.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues north, east, and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This is the section of town between the two gang's territories. This is usually where the violence starts. No Man's land continues south and west; or there is a street to the south.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Hector street bends to the east and the south here. "No Man's Land" entrance is to the north.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Hector street runs east and west. The Bakery used to be to the south but the entrance is sealed off. Probably just a bunch of stale pies in there anyways.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Achilles street heads to the south and Hector runs east and west. There is an entrance to "No Man's Land" to the north. On the southwest corner of this intersection, it looks like a building was recently burned down.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Once a bright spot in the town, it now looks like one of the hardest hit by the violence. The building could collapse at any moment. The street continues east and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: There is a grand fountain to the east but the water doesn't look good to drink. Ajax street heads south and Hector goes back west. "No Man's Land" is to the north.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The street is full of garbage here. An odd building lies to the west, but you don't seem to be able to find a way into it. The street runs north and south here.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The town bards sang of the victory parades that used to pass along this route. It was once a major way through the center of town. The street goes south to a bend and north to an intersection.

Room.Name: A small ruined chapel
Room.Description: This was a small temple built to honor the minor gods and goddesses. It is now desecrated by graffiti and vandalism. Perhaps its worst defilement is that it is the hangout of the Ogre gang. There is a street to the east through a rusty metal door.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The temple to honor the minor gods is through a rusty metal door to the west. The street continues north and south. You hear the muffled sounds of screams coming from the chapel.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: There is a large statue here depicting a battle between two great warriors. You think it's odd that it has not been defiled, but then you sense a aura protecting it. Achilles runs east and south, while Hector heads out to the north.

Room.Name: Achilles Avenue
Room.Description: A large open space, possibly a cemetery, lies to the south. There is a large wrought-iron fence with spikes on top which prevents you from entering the area. The street continues east and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Achilles Avenue bends to the north and west here. There is also a narrow alley to the south.

Room.Name: What is left of the weaponshop
Room.Description: It doesn't even look like those punks gave the weaponsmith a proper burial. But what a going away present he seems to have received! Blood is splattered and dried all over the walls here. It looks like a great deal of carnage happened here. The way out to the east leads out onto a street.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The street goes north and south. The stables used to be to the east, but I bet all the horses are dead or gone.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Not really a "park" as you and i would think of it but it seems queerly peaceful here in comparison to the rest of the area. There seems to be some kind of memorial to the great Mongol warrior Khan being crudely constructed here. There is a street to the east and another to the south.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: A ... park?! lies to the west. The street runs south to an intersection and curves to the north.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The roads bends south and east here. You barely notice a small alley leading north. Some kind of tunnel entrance is to the west but it has been crushed under its own weight.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: A once prideful guildhouse was on the northeast corner of this intersection. Most of the walls and ceiling have long since been demolished. An inn/pub is to the south. The street bends to the east or west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The street goes north or west from here. A narrow street once headed southeast from here.

Room.Name: Entrance to No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The sides of the alleyway have been vandalized many times. One patch of graffiti actually looks readable: This section has been designed for levels 5 through 10 If you are above level 10 please don't expect much. If you are below level 5 enter at your own risk. In another spot it says "now entering Ogre territory..." A street lies to the west and a major road to the east.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: You see many gang members walking around looking for fights to pick and things to break. It seems as if all of the other citizens have been run out of town. All the former homes are boarded up and uninhabitable. The road continues east and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: A park-looking area lies to the north and a passage between two buildings leads to another street to the south.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The Avenue Runs north and south. You sense you are deep within Ogre gang territory, and a chill goes up your spine.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: You can see a sinister black wrought-iron fence to the west. You wonder if it's keeping you out, or the ghouls in?

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The inn actually looks fairly functional despite its lack of repair. The boys come here to hoot it up and drink them selves into oblivion sometimes. It looks as if the beer is still on tap!!! A hallway leads south and you spy a street through the doorway to the north.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: This street forms the southern boundary of Ogre territory. The street extends far to the east. There is also a pathway between buildings which leads to another street to the north.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: Solomon street is to the east and west. The other part of the T is Achilles Avenue, starting here and winding to the north.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: A wrought-iron fence blocks off what used to be an entrance to the cemetery here to the north. The evil just seems too strong to to consider entering. You feel you should stick with the "lesser" evils along the road to the east and west.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The two roads meet at a corner here. Ajax runs north and Solomon heads west. An inn/pub is through a back doorway to the east.

Room.Name: No-Man's-Land Camp
Room.Description: The hallway heads back north to the main part of the inn/pub. The stairs leading up to the guest rooms here do not seem advisable to climb. A doorway empties out into Solomon street to the west.

NPC.name: troll gang member
NPC.description: He's lived a life of violence ever since he was little.
NPC.longDescription: A member of the Trolls wanders about here.

NPC.name: ogre gang member
NPC.description: He wants to rid the world of every last Troll gang member.
NPC.longDescription: A member of the Ogres wanders about here.

NPC.name: gang leader troll
NPC.description: He's risen to be leader through brute force and cunning leadership, you'd guess mostly brute force from the size of his muscles.
NPC.longDescription: The gang leader is not pleased you found his hideout!
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: bruiser troll
NPC.description: He's 6'6" 245 pounds and enough muscle to bash your head in. How like a Troll.
NPC.longDescription: A big, mean bruiser is looking for limbs to break.
NPC.flags: NPC Scavenger Aggressive StayArea Wimpy Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: gang doll
NPC.description: She's a beauty (ok in RELATIVE terms) but you better not touch!
NPC.longDescription: A gang doll looks naughty and nice.
NPC.flags: NPC Scavenger StayArea Wimpy Thief AssistVnum

NPC.name: patrolman patrol man
NPC.description: He'd rather be at the local pub then out here with these nasty kids.
NPC.longDescription: A patrolman is trying to keep the peace.

NPC.name: vandal ogre
NPC.description: He has a wary eye and a fine hand for art.
NPC.longDescription: A vandal is spray painting pro-gang slogans on the wall here.

NPC.name: dog pit bull pitbull
NPC.description: You get a nice close look at him while he's tearing at your throat. His fangs are blood-stained from hearty meals of ... steak?!
NPC.longDescription: A vicious pitbull is foaming at the mouth in rabid anticipation.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Fade AssistAlign AssistRace

NPC.name: punk troll
NPC.description: He's a sterling example of rehabilitation at work. Not nice.
NPC.longDescription: A punk is here, carving his initials into a wall.

NPC.name: gang leader ogre
NPC.description: He's smaller, but undoubtably smarter, than the Troll's leader.
NPC.longDescription: The Ogre gang leader snaps out his stiletto. "Care to dance?"
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive StayArea Thief AssistVnum

NPC.name: thug
NPC.description: The thug isn't quite as big as the Troll's bruisers, but you can tell he loves breaking heads for the Ogres.
NPC.longDescription: An ugly, scarred thug is here, looking for dogs to kick.
NPC.flags: NPC Scavenger Aggressive StayArea Wimpy Warrior AssistVnum

Item.Name: troll jacket
Item.LongDescription: A Troll gang jacket has been carelessly tossed here.

Item.Name: ogre jacket
Item.LongDescription: An Ogre gang jacket has been carelessly tossed here.

Item.Name: chain
Item.LongDescription: A hefty length of chain lies in a heap here on the floor.

Item.Name: metal cover shield
Item.LongDescription: A garbage can lid has been dropped on the floor.

Item.Name: spray paint can
Item.LongDescription: A can of spray paint has been discarded here.

Item.Name: stiletto
Item.LongDescription: A killer stiletto has been forgotten here.

Item.Name: spiked heel boots
Item.LongDescription: A pair of black leather boots with 6 inch spikes have been left here.

Item.Name: mirror
Item.LongDescription: A small mirror has been left here.

Item.Name: gloves
Item.LongDescription: A pair of soft lined leather gloves lie here.

Item.Name: patrol club
Item.LongDescription: A patrolman's club has carelessly been forgotten here.

Item.Name: signet ring
Item.LongDescription: A signet ring bearing the crest of a troll lies in the dust here.

Item.Name: knuckles brass
Item.LongDescription: A set of brass knuckles left from a fight are here on the ground.

Item.Name: pipe lead length
Item.LongDescription: A length of lead pipe sits here, just right for bashing heads.

Item.Name: troll jacket studded
Item.LongDescription: A Troll gang jacket with sewn-in metal studs waits for an owner.

Item.Name: ogre jacket studded
Item.LongDescription: An Ogre gang jacket with sewn-in metal studs waits for an owner.

Item.Name: whistle steel police
Item.LongDescription: You spot a steel whistle on a fine silver chain here.

Item.Name: pants black leather
Item.ShortDescription: a pair of black leather pants
Item.LongDescription: You see some tight-fitting leather pants sitting on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: They're worn, but they look suprisingly tough.

Item.Name: switchblade knife
Item.LongDescription: A strange looking knife is here.

Item.Name: bottle broken
Item.LongDescription: Yowch! You cut your foot on a broken bottle.

ExtraDescription.Description: It appears to be a broken wine bottle, but what do you know about brewing?
